content.question: The binomial theorem can be used to expand the polynomial function <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math>, given by <math alttext="p open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses to the power of 5"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup></math>. What is the coefficient of the <math alttext="x cubed"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math> term in the expanded polynomial?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parentheses negative 3 close parentheses cubed times 10"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><mn>10</mn></math>
<math alttext="open parentheses negative 3 close parentheses squared times 10"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><mn>10</mn></math>
<math alttext="open parentheses negative 3 close parentheses cubed times 5"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><mn>5</mn></math>
<math alttext="open parentheses negative 3 close parentheses squared times 5"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><mn>5</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parentheses negative 3 close parentheses squared times 10"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><mn>10</mn></math>

topic.text: 1.11: Equivalent Representations of Polynomial and Rational Expressions

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
